message.content: This question requires knowledge of what a chemical reaction is and how it is characterized. A chemical reaction occurs when two or more substances combine to form a new substance with different properties. Option (A) is correct because when a knife rusts, it is undergoing a chemical reaction with oxygen in the air to form iron oxide. Option (B) is incorrect because water is a molecule and not an example of a chemical reaction. Option (C) is incorrect because grass is a living organism and not an example of a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because smiling is a facial expression and not an example of a chemical reaction.

This question requires understanding of what constitutes a chemical reaction. A chemical reaction occurs when substances combine or break apart to form new substances with different properties. Option (A), a rusty knife, is an example of a chemical reaction because the iron in the knife reacts with oxygen in the air to form iron oxide (rust). Option (B), water, is incorrect because water itself is not an example of a chemical reaction, although it can be involved in chemical reactions. Option (C), grass, is incorrect because grass is a living organism and its growth and development do not involve chemical reactions. Option (D), smiling, is incorrect because smiling is a facial expression and not a chemical reaction.

This question requires knowledge of what a chemical reaction is and examples of it. A chemical reaction occurs when a substance undergoes a change in its chemical composition. Option (A), a rusty knife, is an example of a chemical reaction because the iron in the knife reacts with oxygen in the air to form iron oxide (rust). Option (B), water, is not an example of a chemical reaction because it is made up of hydrogen and oxygen atoms that remain the same during any physical changes it may undergo. Option (C), grass, is not an example of a chemical reaction because it is a living organism that undergoes biological processes, not chemical reactions. Option (D), smiling, is not an example of a chemical reaction because it is a facial expression caused by muscle movements, which are not chemical changes.

To answer this question, we need to understand what a chemical reaction is. A chemical reaction occurs when two or more substances interact with each other and form new substances. Option (A), a rusty knife, is an example of a chemical reaction because iron reacts with oxygen in the air and forms iron oxide (rust). Option (B), water, is not an example of a chemical reaction because it is a compound made up of two elements, hydrogen and oxygen, and does not undergo a change in its chemical composition. Option (C), grass, is a living organism and does not represent a chemical reaction. Option (D), smiling, is a physical action and does not involve any chemical changes.

This question asks for an example of a chemical reaction, so we need to identify which option represents a chemical reaction. A chemical reaction can be defined as a process that involves the breaking and forming of chemical bonds, resulting in the formation of new substances. Option (A) is the correct answer because when a knife rusts, it undergoes a chemical reaction with oxygen in the air to form iron oxide. Option (B) is incorrect because water (H2O) is a compound that does not undergo a chemical reaction in this context. Option (C) is a plant, which goes through biological processes but not chemical reactions. Option (D) refers to an action that involves facial muscles but does not involve any chemical changes in substances.

Option (A), a rusty knife, is an example of a chemical reaction because the iron in the knife reacts with oxygen in the air to form iron oxide (rust). Option (B), water, is incorrect because it is a compound and not a chemical reaction. Option (C), grass, is incorrect because it is a living organism and not a chemical reaction. Option (D), smiling, is also incorrect because it is a facial expression and not a chemical reaction.

Option (A) is an example of a chemical reaction because when a knife rusts, iron reacts with oxygen in the presence of moisture to form iron oxide. Option (B), water, is not an example of a chemical reaction because it is a compound that exists in its stable form. Option (C), grass, is a living organism and its growth and development involve biological processes rather than chemical reactions. Option (D), smiling, is a facial expression and does not involve a chemical reaction.
